Content: The headwind for $FGI is shippings costs
Author: and those are dropping. They do have debt
Likes: but they are in the black. They have a bevy of strong customers (Home Depot
column7: etc) and they are growing their house brands nicely and dipping their toes into new product lines.   I think the question is
column8: is a dependable profit margin (albeit narrow) a strong plus in this market? And
column9: provided they have that base to build from
column10: can they tailor the operation to broaden the margin and the value proposition?   They were split from Foremost specifically because Foremost thought that the division could grow faster on its own. That's why Foremost did it...and Foremost has been in the business for a long time and has confidence in the strategy.   What I see here is a really strong foundation to build the business on. And a REALLY good SP to get in on. 3x this SP would still be solid...check out any analyst or Simply Wall Street (which pegs fair value at $15.78!).More

Content: Two equities research analysts have issued 12 month price objectives for FGI Industries' shares. Their forecasts range from $7.00 to $8.50. On average
Author: they anticipate FGI Industries' share price to reach $7.75 in the next year. This suggests a possible upside of 93.3% from the stock's current price. And look what Simply Wall Street says it is worth...$10.19. It trades at a forward P/E of 5...the average for the Trade Distributors industry is 14x. Marketwatch anticipates a nice average EPS increase...from .60 in 2021 to .69 in 2022 and .81 in 2023. That's a 15% EPS increase this year and then a 17% increase on top of that.What's a good PT for FGI? A lot more than the current SP. We closed at $4.86 on 31 January. Touched $6.25 that day. I fully expect us to test and pass that shortly. We should see 7-8 shortly
RelativeDate: possibly before earnings. Great earnings could give this a big boost past that
Likes: just given the market momentum at the moment.Am I being wildly optimistic? I think I am being REALISTIC under optimal circumstances. And I think we are experiencing optimal circumstances. So far
Dislikes: the chart bears this out. The broader market could become a drag if risk/growth sentiment shifts. That said
column8: this may disconnect us and get us at least into a 7+ scenario.Just one fellow's opinion.More
